meaning: seeing; eye consciousness; visual awareness
example_1: cakkhuṃ bhikkhave ādittaṃ, rūpā ādittā, cakkhuviññāṇaṃ ādittaṃ, cakkhusamphasso āditto.

meaning: takes life; kills

meaning: should be set aside; should be placed aside; should be left alone

meaning: lets fall; drops

meaning: is evident
example_1: so vat'āvuso, cakkhusmiṃ sati rūpe sati cakkhuviññāṇe sati phassapaññattiṃ paññāpessatī'ti

meaning: recognition of unpleasantness (of); perception of repulsiveness (of)
example_1: āhāre paṭikūlasaññāparicitena, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno cetasā bahulaṃ viharato rasataṇhāya cittaṃ patilīyati patikuṭati pativattati, na sampasāriyati upekkhā vā pāṭikulyatā vā saṇṭhāti.
example_2: pañc'imā, bhikkhave, saññā bhāvitā bahulīkatā mahapphalā honti mah'ānisaṃsā amat'ogadhā amatapariyosānā. katamā pañca? asubhasaññā, maraṇasaññā, ādīnavasaññā, āhāre paṭikūlasaññā, sabbaloke anabhiratasaññā.
example_3: asubhasaññā, maraṇasaññā, āhāre paṭikūlasaññā, sabbaloke anabhiratasaññā, aniccasaññā, anicce dukkhasaññā, dukkhe anattasaññā, pahānasaññā, virāgasaññā, nirodhasaññā

meaning: fortified by the perception of repulsiveness (towards)
example_1: āhāre paṭikūlasaññāparicitena, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno cetasā bahulaṃ viharato rasataṇhāya cittaṃ patilīyati patikuṭati pativattati, na sampasāriyati upekkhā vā pāṭikulyatā vā saṇṭhāti.

meaning: aversion; repulsion; resistance; irritation; conflict
example_1: na paro paraṃ nikubbetha, n'ātimaññetha katthaci naṃ kiñci, byārosanā, paṭighasaññā, n'āññam'aññassa dukkham'iccheyya.
example_2: atthi, bhikkhave, paṭighanimittaṃ. tattha ayonisomanasikārabahulīkāro, ayam'āhāro anuppannassa vā byāpādassa uppādāya, uppannassa vā byāpādassa bhiyyobhāvāya vepullāya.
example_3: ettha ce n'atthi abhinanditabbaṃ abhivaditabbaṃ ajjhositabbaṃ. es'ev'anto rāg'ānusayānaṃ, es'ev'anto paṭigh'ānusayānaṃ

meaning: withdraws from; pulls back (from)
example_1: yassa khv'āhaṃ atthāya cittaṃ paṇidahiṃ so me attho abhinipphanno. handa dāni paṭisaṃharāmī'ti
example_2: akusalaṃ idaṃ kāyakammaṃ dukkh'udrayaṃ dukkhavipākan'ti, paṭisaṃhareyyāsi tvaṃ, rāhula, evarūpaṃ kāyakammaṃ.
example_3: so paṭisaṃharati c'eva na ca vitakketi na ca vicāreti. avitakko'mhi avicāro, ajjhattaṃ satimā sukham'asmī'ti pajānāti.

meaning: bends away (from); turns aside (from)
example_1: āhāre paṭikūlasaññāparicitena, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno cetasā bahulaṃ viharato rasataṇhāya cittaṃ patilīyati patikuṭati pativattati, na sampasāriyati upekkhā vā pāṭikulyatā vā saṇṭhāti.

meaning: withdraws (from); pulls away (from); draws back (from)
example_1: āhāre paṭikūlasaññāparicitena, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno cetasā bahulaṃ viharato rasataṇhāya cittaṃ patilīyati patikuṭati pativattati, na sampasāriyati upekkhā vā pāṭikulyatā vā saṇṭhāti.

meaning: bends back; goes back; fold backwards
example_1: āhāre paṭikūlasaññāparicitena, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno cetasā bahulaṃ viharato rasataṇhāya cittaṃ patilīyati patikuṭati pativattati, na sampasāriyati upekkhā vā pāṭikulyatā vā saṇṭhāti.

meaning: last bowl; worst bowl
example_1: tena bhikkhunā so patto bhikkhuparisāya nissajjitabbo, yo ca tassā bhikkhuparisāya pattapariyanto, so tassa bhikkhuno padātabbo, ayaṃ te bhikkhu patto yāva bhedanāya dhāretabbo'ti, ayaṃ tattha sāmīci.

meaning: words and phrases
example_1: tassa, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno bhāsitaṃ n'eva abhinanditabbaṃ nappaṭikkositabbaṃ. anabhinanditvā appaṭikkositvā padabyañjanāni sādhukaṃ uggahetvā sutte otāretabbāni, vinaye sandassetabbāni.
example_2: so catassannaṃ parisānaṃ dhammaṃ deseti parimaṇḍalehi padabyañjanehi anuppabandhehi anusayasamugghātāya. evarūpena kho, āvuso sāriputta, bhikkhunā gosiṅgasālavanaṃ sobheyyā'ti.

meaning: should be given (to); should be presented (to); should be offered (to)
example_1: tena bhikkhunā so patto bhikkhuparisāya nissajjitabbo, yo ca tassā bhikkhuparisāya pattapariyanto, so tassa bhikkhuno padātabbo, ayaṃ te bhikkhu patto yāva bhedanāya dhāretabbo'ti, ayaṃ tattha sāmīci.

meaning: making effort; exerting; striving; trying (to)
example_1: seyyath'īdaṃ, cattāro satipaṭṭhānā cattāro sammappadhānā cattāro iddhipādā pañc'indriyāni pañca balāni satta bojjh'aṅgā ariyo aṭṭh'aṅgiko maggo.
example_2: dvinn'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, dhammānaṃ upaññāsiṃ, yā ca asantuṭṭhitā kusalesu dhammesu, yā ca appaṭivānitā padhānasmiṃ.
example_3: karaṇīyam'etaṃ brāhmaṇena, padhānaṃ akilāsunā, kāmānaṃ vippahānena, na ten'āsīsate bhavan'ti.
example_4: puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, dubbhikkhaṃ hoti dussassaṃ dullabhapiṇḍaṃ, na sukaraṃ uñchena paggahena yāpetuṃ. ayaṃ, bhikkhave, tatiyo asamayo padhānāya.

meaning: moreover this; but this
example_1: taṃ kho pan'idaṃ dukkhasamudayo ariyasaccaṃ pahātabban'ti

meaning: according to the correct measurement; of the right size; correct-sized
example_1: nisīdanaṃ pana bhikkhunā kārayamānena pamāṇikaṃ kāretabbaṃ, tatr'idaṃ pamāṇaṃ, dīghaso dve vidatthiyo sugatavidatthiyā, tiriyaṃ diyaḍḍhaṃ, dasā vidatthi.
example_2: saññācikāya pana bhikkhunā kuṭiṃ kārayamānena assāmikaṃ att'uddesaṃ pamāṇikā kāretabbā, tatr'idaṃ pamāṇaṃ, dīghaso dvādasa vidatthiyo sugatavidatthiyā, tiriyaṃ satt'antarā

meaning: saturates; permeates; impregnates; completely infuses; spreads everywhere
example_1: so imam'eva kāyaṃ vivekajena pītisukhena abhisandeti parisandeti paripūreti parippharati, n'āssa kiñci sabbāvato kāyassa vivekajena pītisukhena apphuṭaṃ hoti.

meaning: searches; seeks; seeks out; looks (for)
example_1: sace āyasmato channassa n'atthi sappāyāni bhojanāni, ahaṃ āyasmato channassa sappāyāni bhojanāni pariyesissāmi. sace āyasmato channassa n'atthi sappāyāni bhesajjāni, ahaṃ āyasmato channassa sappāyāni bhesajjāni pariyesissāmi.
example_2: te iminā kāyena aṭṭīyamānā harāyamānā jigucchamānā satthahārakaṃ pariyesanti.
example_3: yo pana bhikkhu sañcicca manussaviggahaṃ jīvitā voropeyya satthahārakaṃ v'āssa pariyeseyya maraṇavaṇṇaṃ vā saṃvaṇṇeyya maraṇāya vā samādapeyya
example_4: orena ce māso seso gimhānan'ti vassikasāṭikacīvaraṃ pariyeseyya, oren'addhamāso seso gimhānan'ti katvā nivāseyya, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.

meaning: good at the end; beneficial at the conclusion
example_1: so dhammaṃ deseti ādikalyāṇaṃ majjhekalyāṇaṃ pariyosānakalyāṇaṃ sātthaṃ sabyañjanaṃ kevalaparipuṇṇaṃ parisuddhaṃ brahmacariyaṃ pakāseti

meaning: soaks; drenches
example_1: so imam'eva kāyaṃ vivekajena pītisukhena abhisandeti parisandeti paripūreti parippharati, n'āssa kiñci sabbāvato kāyassa vivekajena pītisukhena apphuṭaṃ hoti

meaning: stuck (in); immersed (in); sunk (into)
example_1: ambho purisa, na tvaṃ addasa manussesu itthiṃ vā purisaṃ vā ābādhikaṃ dukkhitaṃ bāḷhagilānaṃ, sake muttakarīse palipannaṃ semānaṃ, aññehi vuṭṭhāpiyamānaṃ, aññehi saṃvesiyamānan'ti?
example_2: so vata, cunda, attanā palipapalipanno paraṃ palipapalipannaṃ uddharissatīti netaṃ ṭhānaṃ vijjati. so vata, cunda, attanā apalipapalipanno paraṃ palipapalipannaṃ uddharissatīti ṭhānam'etaṃ vijjati

meaning: domestic animal; livestock; farm animal
example_1: na tassa puttā pasavo, khettaṃ vatthuñ'ca vijjati, attā vā'pi nirattā vā, na tasmiṃ upalabbhati.
example_2: hitvā agāraṃ pabbajitā, hitvā puttaṃ pasuṃ viyaṃ, hitvā rāgañ'ca dosañ'ca, avijjañ'ca virājiya, khīṇ'āsavā arahanto, te lokasmiṃ anussukā'ti.
example_3: taṃ puttapasusammattaṃ, byāsattamanasaṃ naraṃ, suttaṃ gāmaṃ mah'ogho'va, maccu ādāya gacchati.

meaning: should be given up (by); should be abandoned (by)
example_1: taṃ kho pan'idaṃ dukkhasamudayo ariyasaccaṃ pahātabban'ti
example_2: kull'ūpamaṃ vo, bhikkhave, dhammaṃ desitaṃ, ājānantehi dhammā'pi vo pahātabbā pag'eva adhammā.
example_3: abhiññeyyaṃ abhiññātaṃ, bhāvetabbañ'ca bhāvitaṃ, pahātabbaṃ pahīnaṃ me, tasmā buddho'smi brāhmaṇa.
example_4: tassa evaṃ yoniso manasikaroto tīṇi saṃyojanāni pahīyanti, sakkāyadiṭṭhi, vicikicchā, sīlabbataparāmāso. ime vuccanti āsavā dassanā pahātabbā.

meaning: aversion (to); disgust (for); revulsion (toward)
example_1: āhāre paṭikūlasaññāparicitena, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno cetasā bahulaṃ viharato, rasataṇhāya cittaṃ patilīyati patikuṭati pativattati, na sampasāriyati, upekkhā vā pāṭikulyatā vā saṇṭhāti.
example_2: asubhanimitt'ānuyogaṃ anuyuttassa kho, nāgita, subhanimitte pāṭikulyatā saṇṭhāti, eso tassa nissando.
example_3: evaṃdiṭṭhino, bhikkhave, etaṃ pāṭikaṅkhaṃ, yā c'āyaṃ bhave appaṭikulyatā, sā c'assa na bhavissati. yā c'āyaṃ bhavanirodhe pāṭikulyatā, sā c'assa na bhavissatī'ti.

meaning: mansion; stately home; palace; building with pillars
example_1: tam'enaṃ evaṃ vadeyyuṃ, ambho purisa, yassa tvaṃ pāsādassa ārohaṇāya nisseṇiṃ karosi, jānāsi taṃ pāsādaṃ puratthimāya vā disāya dakkhiṇāya vā disāya pacchimāya vā disāya uttarāya vā disāya ucco vā nīco vā majjhimo vā'ti?
example_2: tena kho pana samayena bārāṇasiyaṃ yaso nāma kulaputto seṭṭhiputto sukhumālo hoti. tassa tayo pāsādā honti, eko hem'antiko, eko gimhiko, eko vassiko.
example_3: atha kho, bhikkhave, bandhumā rājā vipassissa kumārassa tayo pāsāde kārāpesi, ekaṃ vassikaṃ ekaṃ hem'antikaṃ ekaṃ gimhikaṃ, pañca kāmaguṇāni upaṭṭhāpesi
example_4: pamādaṃ appamādena, yadā nudati paṇḍito, paññāpāsādam'āruyha, asoko sokiniṃ pajaṃ, pabbataṭṭho'va bhūmaṭṭhe, dhīro bāle avekkhati.

meaning: should be asked; could be asked
example_1: anabhinanditvā appaṭikkositvā pañho pucchitabbo, cattāro'me, āvuso, vohārā tena bhagavatā jānatā passatā arahatā sammāsambuddhena samma'd'akkhātā. katame cattāro?
example_2: evañ'ca kho eso, bhikkhu, pañho pucchitabbo

meaning: concept of contact; what is called sense impingement
example_1: so vat'āvuso, cakkhusmiṃ sati rūpe sati cakkhuviññāṇe sati phassapaññattiṃ paññāpessatī'ti, ṭhānam'etaṃ vijjati. phassapaññattiyā sati vedanāpaññattiṃ paññāpessatī'ti, ṭhānam'etaṃ vijjati.

meaning: name of Vipassī Buddha's father
example_1: atha kho, bhikkhave, bandhumā rājā vipassissa kumārassa tayo pāsāde kārāpesi, ekaṃ vassikaṃ ekaṃ hem'antikaṃ ekaṃ gimhikaṃ, pañca kāmaguṇāni upaṭṭhāpesi

meaning: often; frequently
example_1: āhāre paṭikūlasaññāparicitena, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno cetasā bahulaṃ viharato, rasataṇhāya cittaṃ patilīyati patikuṭati pativattati, na sampasāriyati, upekkhā vā pāṭikulyatā vā saṇṭhāti.
example_2: abhijjhālu nu kho bahulaṃ viharāmi, anabhijjhālu nu kho bahulaṃ viharāmi, byāpannacitto nu kho bahulaṃ viharāmi, abyāpannacitto nu kho bahulaṃ viharāmi
example_3: ye'me pañca kāmaguṇā cetaso samphuṭṭhapubbā atītā niruddhā vipariṇatā, tatra me cittaṃ bahulaṃ gacchamānaṃ gaccheyya paccuppannesu vā appaṃ vā anāgatesu.
example_4: yaññad'eva, bhikkhave, bhikkhu bahulam'anuvitakketi anuvicāreti, tathā tathā nati hoti cetaso.

meaning: should be practised often; should be developed
example_1: bhikkhave, ye te mayā dhammā abhiññā desitā, te vo sādhukaṃ uggahetvā āsevitabbā bhāvetabbā bahulīkātabbā
example_2: na āsevitabbaṃ, na bhāvetabbaṃ, na bahulīkātabbaṃ, bhāyitabbaṃ etassa sukhassā'ti, vadāmi.

meaning: should be answered; to be replied (to)
example_1: atthi bhikkhave pañho ek'aṃsabyākaraṇīyo, atthi pañho vibhajjabyākaraṇīyo, atthi pañho paṭipucchābyākaraṇīyo, atthi pañho ṭhapanīyo.
example_2: sac'āyaṃ, bhikkhave, puggalo pañhaṃ puṭṭho samāno ek'aṃsabyākaraṇīyaṃ pañhaṃ na ek'aṃsena byākaroti, vibhajjabyākaraṇīyaṃ pañhaṃ na vibhajja byākaroti, paṭipucchābyākaraṇīyaṃ pañhaṃ na paṭipucchā byākaroti, ṭhapanīyaṃ pañhaṃ na ṭhapeti, evaṃ sant'āyaṃ, bhikkhave, puggalo akaccho hoti.

meaning: should be associated with; should be kept company with; should be adhered to; (comm) should be stuck to
example_1: sevitabbe dhamme na jānāti asevitabbe dhamme na jānāti, bhajitabbe dhamme na jānāti abhajitabbe dhamme na jānāti.
example_2: katamo ca, bhikkhave, puggalo sevitabbo bhajitabbo payirupāsitabbo? idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo sīlavā hoti kalyāṇadhammo.

meaning: being cultivated; being developed
example_1: cattāro'me, bhikkhave, kālā sammā bhāviyamānā sammā anuparivattiyamānā anupubbena āsavānaṃ khayaṃ pāpenti

meaning: should be cultivated; should be developed
example_1: bhikkhave, ye te mayā dhammā abhiññā desitā, te vo sādhukaṃ uggahetvā āsevitabbā bhāvetabbā bahulīkātabbā
example_2: abhiññeyyaṃ abhiññātaṃ, bhāvetabbañ'ca bhāvitaṃ, pahātabbaṃ pahīnaṃ me, tasmā buddho'smi brāhmaṇa.
example_3: yā c'āvuso, paññā yañ'ca viññāṇaṃ, imesaṃ dhammānaṃ saṃsaṭṭhānaṃ no visaṃsaṭṭhānaṃ paññā bhāvetabbā, viññāṇaṃ pariññeyyaṃ. idaṃ nesaṃ nānākaraṇan'ti.
example_4: anicce dukkhasaññā, dukkhe anattasaññā, pahānasaññā, virāgasaññā, nirodhasaññā, rāgassa abhiññāya ime dasa dhammā bhāvetabbā'ti.

meaning: to cultivate; to develop; to grow; to increase
example_1: kusalaṃ, bhikkhave, bhāvetha. sakkā, bhikkhave, kusalaṃ bhāvetuṃ. no ce'daṃ, bhikkhave, sakkā abhavissa kusalaṃ bhāvetuṃ, n'āhaṃ evaṃ vadeyyaṃ, kusalaṃ, bhikkhave, bhāvethā'ti.
example_2: karuṇaṃ bhāvetu'kāmena pana nikkaruṇatāya ādīnavaṃ karuṇāya ca ānisaṃsaṃ paccavekkhitvā karuṇābhāvanā ārabhitabbā.
example_3: yāvañ'c'idaṃ, bhikkhave, alam'eva animitto samādhi bhāvetuṃ. animitto, bhikkhave, samādhi bhāvito bahulīkato mahapphalo hoti mah'ānisaṃso.

meaning: assembly of monks; gathering of monastics
example_1: tena bhikkhunā so patto bhikkhuparisāya nissajjitabbo, yo ca tassā bhikkhuparisāya pattapariyanto, so tassa bhikkhuno padātabbo, ayaṃ te bhikkhu patto yāva bhedanāya dhāretabbo'ti, ayaṃ tattha sāmīci.

meaning: breaking; splitting apart; dividing
example_1: tena bhikkhunā so patto bhikkhuparisāya nissajjitabbo, yo ca tassā bhikkhuparisāya pattapariyanto, so tassa bhikkhuno padātabbo, ayaṃ te bhikkhu patto yāva bhedanāya dhāretabbo'ti, ayaṃ tattha sāmīci.
example_2: yo pana bhikkhu samaggassa saṅghassa bhedāya parakkameyya, bhedanasaṃvattanikaṃ vā adhikaraṇaṃ samādāya paggayha tiṭṭheyya, so bhikkhu bhikkhūhi evam'assa vacanīyo

meaning: good in the middle; beneficial in the middle
example_1: so dhammaṃ deseti ādikalyāṇaṃ majjhekalyāṇaṃ pariyosānakalyāṇaṃ sātthaṃ sabyañjanaṃ, kevalaparipuṇṇaṃ parisuddhaṃ brahmacariyaṃ pakāseti.

meaning: clay; earth
example_1: seyyathā'pi, āvuso, kaṭṭhañ'ca paṭicca valliñ'ca paṭicca tiṇañ'ca paṭicca mattikañ'ca paṭicca ākāso parivārito agāraṃ tv'eva saṅkhaṃ gacchati
example_2: yo pana bhikkhu jānaṃ sappāṇakaṃ udakaṃ tiṇaṃ vā mattikaṃ vā siñceyya vā siñcāpeyya vā, pācittiyaṃ.

meaning: should be attended to; should be kept in mind
example_1: katame ca dhammā manasikaraṇīyā ye dhamme manasi karoti? yassa dhamme manasikaroto anuppanno vā kām'āsavo na uppajjati, uppanno vā kām'āsavo pahīyati
example_2: idha, bhikkhave, assutavā puthujjano manasikaraṇīye dhamme nappajānāti, amanasikaraṇīye dhamme nappajānāti

meaning: human being; human individual
example_1: yo pana bhikkhu sañcicca manussaviggahaṃ jīvitā voropeyya, satthahārakaṃ v'āssa pariyeseyya, maraṇavaṇṇaṃ vā saṃvaṇṇeyya, maraṇāya vā samādapeyya

meaning: praise of death; advantage of death
example_1: yo pana bhikkhu sañcicca manussaviggahaṃ jīvitā voropeyya, satthahārakaṃ v'āssa pariyeseyya, maraṇavaṇṇaṃ vā saṃvaṇṇeyya, maraṇāya vā samādapeyya

meaning: complete comprehension of conceit; total understanding of comparison
example_1: ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, bhikkhu sabb'āsavasaṃvarasaṃvuto viharati, acchecchi taṇhaṃ, vivattayi saṃyojanaṃ, sammā mān'ābhisamayā antam'akāsi dukkhassā'ti

meaning: urine and excrement
example_1: ye'pi te, bhikkhave, rañño nāgā gāmanigamarājadhānīsu, daḷhehi varattehi baddhā, te'pi tāni bandhanāni sañchinditvā sampadāletvā bhītā muttakarīsaṃ cajamānā , yena vā tena vā palāyanti.
example_2: ambho purisa, na tvaṃ addasa manussesu itthiṃ vā purisaṃ vā ābādhikaṃ dukkhitaṃ bāḷhagilānaṃ, sake muttakarīse palipannaṃ semānaṃ, aññehi vuṭṭhāpiyamānaṃ, aññehi saṃvesiyamānan'ti?
example_3: disvāna taṇhaṃ aratiṃ ragañ'ca, n'āhosi chando api methunasmiṃ, kim'ev'idaṃ muttakarīsapuṇṇaṃ, pādā'pi naṃ samphusituṃ na icche.

meaning: as decreed; as prescribed; as formulated
example_1: yāvakīvañ'ca bhikkhave bhikkhū apaññattaṃ na paññāpessanti, paññattaṃ na samucchindissanti, yathāpaññattesu sikkhāpadesu samādāya vattissanti

meaning: to sustain oneself (with); to support oneself (by); to keep oneself going
example_1: puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, dubbhikkhaṃ hoti dussassaṃ dullabhapiṇḍaṃ, na sukaraṃ uñchena paggahena yāpetuṃ. ayaṃ, bhikkhave, tatiyo asamayo padhānāya.

meaning: as many as three times; after the third time; up to the third time
example_1: yathā kho pana paccekapuṭṭhassa veyyākaraṇaṃ hoti, evam'evaṃ evarūpāya parisāya yāvatatiyaṃ anusāvitaṃ hoti.
